Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2009 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $80,000, or over $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for FY'09 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $80,000, or over $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for Fiscal Year 2009 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than eighty thousand dollars ($80,000), or not more than eighty thousand dollars ($80,000) per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for FY'09 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than eighty thousand dollars ($80,000), or not more than eighty thousand dollars ($80,000) per residential unit.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2009 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $80,000, or over $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments; and 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $80,000, or not more $80,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate to be charged for FY'09 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $80,000, or over $80,000 per residential unit.

Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Lanza, S. 6811, and Assembly Member Kavanagh, A. 10071, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to authorizing a city with a population of one million or more to make the obstruction of traffic intersections a parking violation”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Blocking the box fine (S.6811/A.10071)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.MinutesNote:
Editor's Note: This brief Recessed Meeting held on June 12 is considered a continuation of the Stated Council Meeting of May 28, 2008. With this in mind, the following below reflect the newly revised and final attendance and vote totals:

Including the Roll Call results of this brief Recessed Meeting held on June 12, 2008, the final revised votes for the official May 28, 2008 Stated Council Meeting are as follows:

48 Council Members Present (now including the 3 Council Members present at the Recessed Meeting held on June 12, 2008 who were originally absent from the Stated Council Meeting held on May 28, 2008: CMs Dickens, Palma, & Sanders)

Land Use Call-ups: 45-0-0 with 3 Council Membes now Present but not Voting (CMs Dickens, Palma, & Sanders)

General Order votes: 45-0-0 with 3 Council Members now Present but not Voting (CMs Dickens, Palma, & Sanders)

(CM White was not present for the Stated Meeting held on May 28, 2008 nor was he present for the brief Recessed Meeting held on June 12, 2008, but he did enter at a later point and was marked present for the scheduled June 12, 2008 Stated Council Meeting below)
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

LU No. 794 & Res No. 1491,   47-1-0
SLR 111, 41-7-0
SLR 120, 39-9-0
SLR 123, 41-7-0

The following legislative items coupled for approval were Defeated by the Council by the vote of 21-25-2 (but, however, since these item were not coupled for Approval as opposed to Disapproval, the defeat of these Land Use related items does not end the matter--pursuant to City Charter Rule, these same items will be considered Adopted on July 22, 2008 due to Council inaction on these matters within the required proscribed time period) :

LU No. 751 & Res No. 1478
LU No. 752 & Res No. 1479
LU No. 753 & Res No. 1480
LU No. 754 & Res No. 1481


See files for individual votes.
Recessed Meeting of May 28, 2008 held on June 12, 2008.

Editor's Note: At this Stated Meeting held on June 12, 2008, Council Members Baez, Mendez and Weprin were not present.  At the Recessed Meeting of June 12, 2008 held on June 23, 2008, however, these 3 Council Members were present and are therefore marked present  for the revised Roll Call for Attendance shown above (see also notes following the land Use Call-up vote and the General Orders vote printed in these Minutes).

Editor's Note: The vote above is the revised Land Use call-up vote which includes Council Member Weprin's affirmative vote cast at the Recessed Meeting held on June 23, 2008.  In addition, Council Members Baez and Mendez are considered Present but Not Voting for this Land Use call-up vote by their attendance at the Recessed Meeting held on June 23, 2008 (see further notes in the General Orders vote section of these Minutes).
